title.narrative: “SESAMAI” Sostegno alle politiche sanitarie nazionali e ai servizi di salute materno-infantile

description.narrative: Il progetto si fonda sulla consapevolezza che l’approccio alla salute della madre e del bambino nei primi 1.000 giorni di vita non può prescindere da una visione olistica e integrata al benessere psicofisico della donna e del bambino. Oltre ai servizi di base di assistenza durante la gravidanza, al parto ed al puerperio e al neonato, in coordinamento con le Organizzazioni della Società Civile, si assicurerà l’ assistenza tecnica alle istituzioni sudanesi a livello centrale e decentrato nella elaborazione di politiche sanitarie, in particolare in ambito materno-infantile Accanto agli aspetti eminentemente clinici verrà associata una incisiva azione nel settore nutrizionale, per complementare l’iniziativa con quella necessaria attenzione che va data alla dimensione nutrizionale così da sviluppare una sinergia che generi un impatto moltiplicatore

The project is based on the awareness that the approach to the health of the mother and child in the first years of life cannot be separated from a holistic and integrated vision of the psychophysical well-being of women and children. In addition to basic assistance services during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium and the newborn, in coordination with the Civil Society Organizations, specific technical assistance will be granted to Sudanese institutions at central and decentralized level in the development of health policies, in particular in the maternal and child sector. Alongside the eminently clinical aspects, a strong action in the nutritional sector will be associated, to complement the initiative with the necessary attention that must be given to the nutritional dimension in order to develop a synergy that generates a multiplier impact.

tag.narrative: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons
By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round

By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births

By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes
By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births
End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Reduce inequality within and among countries
